name: alum
content:
alum noun [U]
(chemistry)
Add to word list
Add to word list
a chemical substance containing aluminium used in dyeing (= changing the colour of something) and as an astringent (= substance that causes skin to tighten)

alum noun [C]
(past member)
short for
alumnus : someone who studied at a particular school, college, or university: Paul, although an Englishman, is an Arizona State alum. The interviewer asks a few questions, including whether the applicant is the child of an alum.
short for
alumnus : someone who worked for a particular organization, was involved in a particular TV show, etc., earlier in their working life: Her comedian husband, like her, is a "Saturday Night Live" alum. He's an alum of the Chicago Theater Company.
More examplesFewer examplesHe started his own company with a fellow Stanford alum.The school counts on successful alums to contribute both money and expertise.The "Sopranos" alum plays Nick, a factory worker living in the Bronx.She co-wrote the screenplay with another "Frasier" writer alum.
